CSS HOME.notes: Explore the different sections to learn about CSS concepts, syntax, and best practices.

CSS Intro.notes: CSS stands for Cascading Style Sheets and is used to style HTML documents.

CSS Syntax.notes: A CSS rule consists of a selector and a declaration block.

CSS Selectors.notes: Selectors are used to target the HTML elements you want to style.

CSS Colors.notes: CSS supports color names, HEX, RGB, RGBA, HSL, and HSLA values.

CSS Backgrounds.notes: Background properties allow you to set background color, image, position, and more.

CSS Borders.notes: Borders can be styled with width, color, and style properties.

CSS Margins.notes: Margins create space around elements, outside of any defined borders.

CSS Padding.notes: Padding creates space around content, inside of any defined borders.

CSS Box Model.notes: The box model describes the design and layout of elements.

CSS Display.notes: The display property specifies if/how an element is displayed.
